explains: adj. 第一流的；靠得住的；独特的；蓝色筹码的

sentences.en: Blue-chip borrowers raised billions of dollars of new debt.
sentences.cn: 蓝筹公司也筹集了几十亿新债务。

sentences.en: The mix of state, blue-chip, foreign and family owners has been remarkably stable.
sentences.cn: 国企，蓝筹，外资和家族企业的混合意外的稳定。

sentences.en: The big firms were among the first to win blue-chip American and European clients and to adopt blue-chip governance and accounting norms themselves.
sentences.cn: 这些大公司是第一批赢得欧美热门客户的公司，也是第一批通过调整蓝筹监管和会计规范自己的人？
